analyzed: vande sindūra sandoha sundara aruṇa
translated: I praise the god whose reddish radiance is beautiful with a mass of vermilion,

analyzed: stamberam ānanam devam indra ādi sura vanditam
translated: whose face is like a wine jar, and who is worshipped by Indra and other gods.

original: mahadahaṅkṛtikhānilakānalakṣitiguṇodayaśaktivijṛmbhitam /🔽jagadidaṃ gaṇasaṃjñitamasya yad gaṇapatiḥ patireṣa śivaḥ svayam // //
analyzed: mahat ahaṅkṛti kha anilaka anala kṣiti guṇa udaya śakti vijṛmbhitam  jagat idam gaṇa saṃjñitam asya yat gaṇapatiḥ patiḥ eṣa śivaḥ svayam
translated: This universe, known as the group, is the manifestation of the power of the arising of the qualities of Mahat, Ahamkara, Earth, Water, Fire, and Air.🔽The one who is called Ganapati, the lord of the group, is this Shiva himself.

original: vikurute nikhilaṃ khaluśaktitaḥ puruṣa eṣa śivaḥ sa cikīrṣayā /
analyzed: vikurute nikhilam khalu śaktitaḥ puruṣaḥ eṣa śivaḥ sa cikīrṣayā
translated: The Purusha, this Shiva, indeed manifests everything through his power with the desire to create.

analyzed: tat avanam ca sa saṃhṛtim icchayā vitanute tanu bheda vilakṣaṇaḥ
translated: And that Lord, who is unlike any other body, freely creates and withdraws that universe.

analyzed: hari viriñca maheśa mukhāḥ surāḥ jagati vighna gaṇaiḥ api nighnitāḥ
translated: The gods headed by Hari, Brahma, and Maheshvara are indeed afflicted by multitudes of obstacles in the world.

original: gaṇapateryajanaṃ khalu tanvate yadata eva vibhurhi vināyakaḥ // //🔽sa khalu prapañcamakhilaṃ vyasṛjat purato'vanāya kila tasya vibhuḥ /
analyzed: gaṇapateḥ yajanam khalu tanvate yat atas eva vibhuḥ hi vināyakaḥ  sa khalu prapañcam akhilam vyasṛjat puratas vanāya kila tasya vibhuḥ
translated: But they perform the worship of Ganesha, and therefore the Lord is indeed Vinayaka (the Remover of Obstacles).🔽Indeed, that Lord created the entire universe in front of him for his worship.

original: atha bhūtaye ca jagatāmatanustanumāsthito gajamukhīmabhavat // //🔽samupoḍhaviśvanikhilādhvagaṇāṃ guṇadhātubījaravaṣaṭkayutām /🔽paramāṅgaṣaṭkavihitāṅgavidhiṃ varamūrtiyuṅmithunaṣaṭkamayīm // //
analyzed: atha bhūtaye ca jagatām atanuḥ tanum āsthitaḥ gaja mukhīm abhavat  / samupoḍha viśva nikhila adhva gaṇām guṇa dhātu bīja rava ṣaṭka yutām
translated: Then, for the welfare of the world, he assumed a huge body and became Ganesha with an elephant face.🔽Endowed with the multitude of all the paths of the universe, along with the six seed syllables of the elements,🔽With the six limbs arranged in the six supreme limbs, consisting of the six pairs of excellent forms,

analyzed: jagat eka bhūti jananīm ajarām kamala ambuja akṣa girijā giriśaiḥ
translated: The mother of the sole existence of the world, ageless, with Lakshmi, Shiva, Parvati, and Shiva,

analyzed: rati manmatha avani varāha yutaiḥ paritas girā ca catur āsya vṛtām
translated: Surrounded by the invincible Kama, Madana, and Avani, along with the four-faced one, with speech.

original: smarati vā samanuṃ savidhānakaṃ pratidinaṃ tamimaṃ gaṇanāyakam /
analyzed: smarati vā sa manum sa vidhānakam pratidinam tam imam gaṇanāyakam
translated: One who remembers this Ganesha, along with the prescribed ritual, every day,

original: apacitiṃ pravidhāya japecca yaḥ sa khalu sarvasamīhitabhājanam // //🔽p / praṇavavāgbhavayoritarat purastadanu māgirijāsmarabījayuk /
analyzed: apacitim pravidhāya japet ca yaḥ sa khalu sarva samīhita bhājanam  praṇava vāc bhavayoḥ itarat puras tadanu mā girijā smara bīja yuj
translated: And he who, having made offerings, also recites it, he indeed is the recipient of all that is desired.🔽The other one after Om and Vagbhavah, then the seed syllables of Magirija and Smarah,

analyzed: avani bīja gatam bhuja madhyamam śaśi kalā āḍhya sa vāma vilocanam
translated: Endowed with the middle arm of the earth seed, and the left eye with the digit of the moon.

original: tadanu daṇḍayuto bhujamadhyamo gaṇapateḥ khalu bījavaro hyayam /
analyzed: tadanu daṇḍa yutaḥ bhuja madhyamaḥ gaṇapateḥ khalu bījavaraḥ hi ayam
translated: Then, the middle arm united with the staff, this indeed is the excellent seed syllable of Ganapati.

analyzed: ṣaṣ iti bījavarāṇi samuddharet akhila siddhi karāṇi yathākramam
translated: One should extract the six excellent seed syllables, which bring about all accomplishments in order.

analyzed: udakam akṣi yutam kathitam tatas pavanasārathi rūḍha vilocanam
translated: Then, the water with the eye is mentioned, the eye mounted on the charioteer of the wind,

analyzed: sa nayanau atha khaḍgi bhujaṅgakau iti purā ūrṇa catuṣṭayam uddharet
translated: And then the four in front, with the snake and the sword, one should extract the four in front.

original: hiṇāśa ca haṣaḥ haṣa ḍaṭ sarvalokahṛdayaṃ me vaśaṃ kuru ṭhaṭha //
analyzed: hiṇāśa ca haṣaḥ haṣa ḍaṭ sarva loka hṛdayam me vaśam kuru ṭha ṭha
translated: The horse and the letter Ha, the letter Ha and the letter Da - may the heart of all the worlds come under my control.

analyzed: śruti veda veda guṇa bhogi rasaiḥ gaṇitaiḥ sva varṇa nikaraiḥ tu manoḥ
translated: With the essence of the Vedas, the qualities of the Vedas, the essence of enjoyment, and the essence of the mind,

analyzed: pṛthak ukta bīja sahitaiḥ tu bhavet atha sarva vid pramukha jāti yutaiḥ
translated: With the groups of one's own letters, counted in order, and with the seed syllables mentioned separately, then it becomes endowed with the classes beginning with the omniscient one.

original: sarvajñāya nityatṛptāya anādibodhāya svatantrāya aluptaśaktaye anantaśaktaye evaṃ krameṇa svārṇairāyojya ṣaḍaṅgāni bhavantīti yāvat /
analyzed: sarvajñāya nitya tṛptāya anādi bodhāya svatantrāya alupta śaktaye ananta śaktaye evam krameṇa sva arṇaiḥ āyojya ṣaṣ aṅgāni bhavanti iti yāvat
translated: To the Omniscient One, the Eternally Satisfied One, the Primordial Enlightened One, the Independent One, the One with Unimpaired Power, the One with Infinite Power, in this way, the six limbs are formed by joining with one's own letters in sequence, up to this point.

analyzed: kara śuddhim astra manunā tanu tām nidadhātu atha aṅguliṣu ca aṅga manūn
translated: Then, with the mantra of the weapon, he should place the body and the limb mantras on the fingers,

analyzed: tala madhyake tadanu ca astra manum lipi varṇa mūla pada vat ca tanau
translated: and after that, the weapon mantra, and the letters of the script, on the palm and in the middle, and on the body, like the root words.

original: tatrāṅguṣṭhādikaniṣṭhāntaṃ hṛdayādinetrāntānaṅgamantrān vinyasyāstramantraṃ ca hastatale tadanu liperavargākṣarādikāni ṣaḍbījāni triṣkṛtvo mukhe vinyasya kacaṭatapayādīni ṣaḍvargāṇi mūlamantrasya vikārādīni ṣaṭ padāni bhujadvayapādadvayapārśvadvayeṣu pṛṣṭhanābhihṛdayeṣu ca vinyasyātmānaṃ mātṛkāmbujagataṃ saśaktikaṃ gaṇapatiṃ dhyāyediti yāvat /
analyzed: tatra aṅguṣṭha ādi kaniṣṭhā antam hṛdaya ādi netra antān aṅgamantrān vinyasya astramantram ca hasta tale tadanu lipeḥ avarga akṣara ādikāni ṣaṣ bījāni triṣkṛtvas mukhe vinyasya ka ca ṭa ta pa ya ādīni ṣaṣ vargāṇi mūlamantrasya vikāra ādīni ṣaḍ padāni bhuja dvaya pāda dvaya pārśva dvayeṣu pṛṣṭha nābhi hṛdayeṣu ca vinyasya ātmānam mātṛkā ambuja gatam sa śaktikam gaṇapatim dhyāyet iti yāvat
translated: There, having placed the limb mantras from the thumb to the little finger, from the heart to the eyes, and the weapon mantra on the palm of the hand, after that, he should place the six seed syllables beginning with the class of letters in the script, three times in the mouth, and the six groups beginning with ka, ca, ṭa, ta, pa, and the six words beginning with vikāra of the root mantra, on the two arms, two legs, two sides, back, navel, and heart, up to this point, he should meditate on himself as Lord Gaṇapati, along with Śakti, residing in the lotus of the Mātṛkā (syllables).

original: hṛdayādikeṣvatha ṣaḍaṅgamanūn nijaśastrato'pi ca diśāṃ kalanam /
analyzed: hṛdaya ādikeṣu atha ṣaḍaṅga manūn nija śastra tā api ca diśām kalanam
translated: Then, the limb mantras in the heart and other places, and the arrangement of the directions with one's own weapon,

analyzed: punar astrataḥ jvalita vapra vidhim paritas tu tarjanikayā racayet
translated: Again, with the weapon mantra, one should form the blazing enclosure all around with the index finger.

original: api vāmadevamṛṣimasya tathā pravadanti kecana tathā gaṇakam /
analyzed: api vāmadevam ṛṣim asya tathā pravadanti kecana tathā gaṇakam
translated: Some say that the sage of this mantra is Vāmadeva, and also the mathematician.

original: tadanantarāpi ca nivṛt kathito bhagavān prapañcagaṇapo'dhipatiḥ // //🔽gurumukhāptamanuṃ tadanujñayā girinadītaṭadevagṛhādike /
analyzed: tad anantarā api ca nivṛt kathitaḥ bhagavān  guru mukha āpta manum tad anujñayā giri nadī taṭa devagṛha ādike
translated: And after that, the revered lord of the Gaṇas, the creator of the universe, is declared.🔽Having obtained the mantra from the mouth of the guru with his permission, in a place such as a mountain, riverbank, temple, etc.,

original: kvacidabhīṣṭamanoharalakṣaṇaṃ tvabhinava pravidhāya maṭhaṃ tataḥ // //🔽samucitāhṛtapūjanasādhano vihitanaityakakarma na hāpayan /
analyzed: kvacid abhīṣṭa manohara lakṣaṇam tu abhinava pravidhāya maṭham tatas  samucita āhṛta pūjana sādhanaḥ vihita naityaka karma na hāpayan
translated: Having constructed a new monastery somewhere, pleasing to the mind with desirable characteristics,🔽Having collected the necessary means of worship, not neglecting the daily duties,

analyzed: japatu lakṣam atandrita dhīḥ manum vrati jana udita śastamita aśanaḥ
translated: The vow-observing person should recite the mantra a hundred thousand times with an undistracted mind, eating only the prescribed amount of food.

original: p / iti pūrvasevanavidhau carite manureṣa siddhimadhikāṃ tanute /
analyzed: iti pūrva sevana vidhau carite manuḥ eṣa siddhim adhikām tanute
translated: Thus, when the rite of preliminary service is performed, this mantra bestows great perfection.

analyzed: prativāsaram yajana homa japaiḥ bhajatām bhavanti abhimatāni acirāt
translated: For those who worship with daily offerings, oblations, and recitations, their desired goals are quickly accomplished.

original: atha likhyate'sya tu vidhānavaraṃ smaraṇena sidhyati ca yasya manuḥ /
analyzed: atha likhyate isya tu vidhāna varam smaraṇena sidhyati ca yasya manuḥ
translated: Now, the excellent method of this mantra is written, by the mere recollection of which the mantra becomes successful.

original: pravilikhya citrataracitrapaṭaṃ vibhave yajet sati na cenmanasā // //
analyzed: pravilikhya citratara citra paṭam vibhave yajet sati na ced manasā
translated: If one does not have the means, one should visualize the cloth with the most beautiful and colorful design.

analyzed: atha cintayet udadhim ikṣu rasam laharī taraṅga śata ramyataram
translated: Then one should visualize the ocean as the most beautiful with hundreds of waves and ripples of sugarcane juice,

analyzed: timi nakra śaṅkha kula mīna gaṇaiḥ sa timiṅgila ākula jala ullasitam
translated: Agitated by the water teeming with whales, alligators, conch shells, flocks of fish, and timiṅgila fish.

original: pulinaṃ ca madhyabhuvi tasya mahanmaṇiparvataṃ ca śikharopacitam /
analyzed: pulinam ca madhya bhuvi tasya mahat maṇi parvatam ca śikhara upacitam
translated: And in the middle of it, a great sandy bank, and a jewel mountain with its peak piled high,

analyzed: paritas tamāla vana tāla śataiḥ saralaiḥ ca sāla ghana sāra nagaiḥ
translated: Surrounded by hundreds of tamāla forests and tāla trees, and by dense sāla and sāra trees,

analyzed: sa kadamba nimba nikurumba yutaiḥ api nālikera kara keli śataiḥ  vara kuṇḍa hāli nicula āmravaṇaiḥ kadalī vanaiḥ ca ramaṇīya taṭam  nava pūga pūga gata nāgalatā kula salla kīla valikā maricaiḥ
translated: Also by kadamba, nimba, and nikuramba trees, and by hundreds of coconut and karīra trees,🔽By groves of betel nut trees, and by groves of plantains, with beautiful banks,🔽With fresh mango trees, betel vines, and sallaki trees, with black pepper vines,

analyzed: sa lavaṅka bilva vakulaiḥ ca milat mada cañcalīka kula nāda kalam
translated: With cloves, bilva trees, and vakula trees, resounding with the sweet cooing of flocks of intoxicated cuckoos,🔽With the sweet sound of cuckoos enjoying the taste of mango blossoms,

analyzed: camaraiḥ api sramarakaiḥ caritam sura kinnara asura vara adhyuṣitam
translated: With chamari deer and sramara deer, frequented by gods, kinnaras, and the best of asuras.

analyzed: nava pallava ākula guluccha milat kalikā unmiṣat kusuma bhāra tatīḥ  vratatībhiḥ atra dadhatībhiḥ alam samalaṅkṛtam khaga kula ākulitam
translated: With the tops of the trees crowded with fresh sprouts, with the clusters of flowers swaying with the humming of bees,🔽With the streams flowing here and there, it is well-adorned, crowded with flocks of birds.

original: kuvalayaiḥ kamalaiḥ samalaṅkṛtaṃ samarasaṃ sarasāmapi sārasaiḥ /
analyzed: kuvalayaiḥ kamalaiḥ samalaṅkṛtam samarasam sarasām api sārasaiḥ
translated: Adorned with blue and red lotuses, with the ruddy geese in the lakes, which are the essence of the essence of the lakes,

analyzed: kvacana kairavakaiḥ vikaca utpalaiḥ kuravakaiḥ kalahaṃsa kulaiḥ api  taṭa parisruta nirjhara śīkara utkara bharaiḥ gaja dāna manoharaiḥ  calita candana campaka ketakī parimalaiḥ anilaiḥ api sevitam
translated: In some places with the blooming white lotuses, with the flocks of cranes and Karavīra flowers.🔽With the showers of water flowing down the mountain streams, which are delightful like the gifts of elephants,🔽And with the breezes carrying the fragrance of moving sandal, campaka and ketaki flowers.

analyzed: sakala śītakara udaya candrikā viśada tāraka jālakam ekatas  gaganam udyat udaṃśumat aṃśunā vilasitam kvacid ambu vahaiḥ api  sa madhu mādhava śukra śuci śrite nabhasi yukta nabhasya miṣa ūrjayoḥ
translated: On one side, the sky is clear with the moonlight at the rise of the full moon, with the net of bright stars,🔽And in some places, it shines with the rising sun and the clouds.🔽In the sky, which is the abode of the sweet-smelling spring, the moon, the pure Shukra (Venus), and the sun,

original: sahasi saṅgi sahasyasamaṃ tapaḥ kusumasaṃpadalambhi tapasyatā // //
analyzed: sahasi saṅgi sahasya samam tapaḥ kusuma saṃpad alambhi tapasya tā
translated: The penance of the ascetic, which is the source of the wealth of flowers, is united with the month of Bhadrapada, which is the enemy of the month of Shravana.

analyzed: ṛtu gaṇena samāna guṇa udayam satata saṃbhṛta kausuma sampadā
translated: The wealth of flowers is always accumulated by the group of seasons, which is the source of qualities equal to the full moon.

analyzed: samadhikam samalaṅkṛta kānanam kanaka cāru taṭam pravicintayet
translated: And imagine the forest even more adorned, with beautiful golden banks.

original: p / tanmadhyahemaśikhare maṇihemabhūmau vaprāṇi saptaṃ kanakojjvalabhittikāni /
analyzed: tad madhya hema śikhare maṇi hema bhūmau vaprāṇi saptam kanaka ujjvala bhittikāni
translated: In the middle of that, on a golden peak, on a floor of jewels and gold, there are seven ramparts with walls shining with gold,

original: dhyeyāni tatra ca vimānaśatānukīrṇāḥ kakṣyāśca sapta pṛthamucchritagopurāntāḥ // //
analyzed: dhyeyāni tatra ca vimāna śata anukīrṇāḥ kakṣyāḥ ca sapta pṛtham ucchrita gopura antāḥ
translated: And there, one should imagine, are seven concentric walls filled with hundreds of palaces, with lofty gates at the end.

analyzed: tāsām tu madhya viniviṣṭam ananta ratna chāyā āvṛtam kanaka maṇḍapam ucca śṛṅgam
translated: In the middle of those, there is a golden pavilion with lofty peaks, surrounded by the shade of endless jewels,

original: divyaṃ śaśāṅkamaṇikuṭṭimabhūṣitaṃ syād dhyeyaṃ viśālacaturaśramatīva ramyam // //
analyzed: divyam śaśāṅka maṇi kuṭṭima bhūṣitam syāt dhyeyam viśāla caturaśram atīva ramyam
translated: Divine, adorned with a floor of moon-stones, one should imagine it to be very beautiful, with a spacious square.

analyzed: muktā sraj añcita vitāna sanātha madhyam haimaiḥ maṇi pravara vajra vikāra citraiḥ
translated: In the middle, covered with a canopy strung with pearl garlands, adorned with golden pots inlaid with the best jewels and diamonds,

original: kumbhairvirājitamathāsya caturdiśāsu dvārāṇi citramakarākṛtitoraṇāni // //🔽nānāvidhairmadhurasaiḥ parilambamānaiḥ pakvaiḥ phalaiśca kusumairvaramālyadāmaiḥ /
analyzed: kumbhaiḥ virājitam atha asya catur diśāsu dvārāṇi citra makara ākṛti toraṇāni  nānāvidhaiḥ madhu rasaiḥ parilambamānaiḥ pakvaiḥ phalaiḥ ca kusumaiḥ vara mālya dāmaiḥ
translated: And in the four directions, with gates shaped like makaras with archways.🔽With various sweet substances hanging down, with ripe fruits and excellent flower garlands,

analyzed: śāli agrakaiḥ kanaka pallava modakaiḥ ca vyālambitaiḥ tu parimaṇḍita maṇḍapa antam
translated: With the tips of rice, with the fragrance of golden sprouts and sweets, hanging down, it is adorned all around the pavilion.

analyzed: samantataḥ sa aṅkura pālikābhiḥ maṇi pradīpaiḥ ca hiraṇya dīpaiḥ  sa dhūpa puṣpa akṣata gandha pātraiḥ sa cāmara svastika śaṅkha padmaiḥ
translated: All around, it is adorned with sprouting palanquins, jewel lamps, golden lamps,🔽With vessels containing incense, flowers, raw rice grains and fragrances, with yak-tail whisks, swastika-marked vessels, conch shells and lotuses,

analyzed: virājitam darpaṇa pūrṇa kumbhaiḥ sa lāja kumbhaiḥ api tatra tatra
translated: And with mirrors, full water pots, and pots of parched rice here and there.

analyzed: samāhitaiḥ vāmana kubjaka ādyaiḥ gaṇaiḥ samantāt samalaṅkṛtam tat
translated: It is fully adorned all around with groups of dwarfs, hunchbacks and others in a state of concentration.

analyzed: atha arghya toya ukṣita gandha puṣpa sva ātma ambu yāga ālaya maṇḍapaḥ san
translated: Then, the place of worship, the pavilion, sprinkled with water mixed with fragrances and flowers, and with one's own self as the sacrificial object,

analyzed: bhuvaḥ talānām api ca api adhastāt ādhāra śaktim tu yajet purastāt
translated: One should worship the supporting power below the surface of the earth, in front.

original: tatastvanantaṃ pṛthivīdharaṃ taṃ pṛthvīṃ ca saṃpūjya tu yogapīṭham /
analyzed: tatas tu anantam pṛthivīdharam tam pṛthvīm ca saṃpūjya tu yogapīṭham
translated: Then, having worshipped that Ananta, the supporter of the earth, and the earth, one should worship the yogic seat,

analyzed: yajet ananta ātmakam asya pādān dharma ādikān ukta tanūn yathāvat
translated: And one's own feet, which are of the nature of Ananta, and the elements beginning with earth, as described, in the proper order.

original: rajastamassattvamayāni kundaṃ nālāmbuje ca pravicintya padme /
analyzed: rajaḥ tamaḥ sattva mayāni kundam nāla ambuje ca pravicintya padme

analyzed: krameṇa sūrya agni niśākarāṇām tad patra tad kesara karṇikāḥ syuḥ
translated: In due order, the petals, filaments and pericarp should be of the sun, fire and moon respectively.

analyzed: tat mātṛkā abjam lipi varṇa juṣṭam pūrva ukta bhaṅgyā paribhāvya tasmin
translated: That lotus of the mother-mantra, adorned with the letters of the alphabet, having contemplated it in the manner described earlier,

analyzed: diś patra koṇa chadana kramāt syuḥ pūjyāḥ sa pīṭha aṣṭaka mātṛ rudrāḥ
translated: The eight mothers and Rudras, along with their seats, should be worshipped in the directions, petals, and corners, in order.

analyzed: prācyām śrī kāmarūpaḥ yama diśi ca tathā kolla pūrvaḥ giriḥ syāt
translated: In the east is Shri Kamarupa, in the south is the mountain Kollapurva,

analyzed: āgneyyām ca api tadvat malaya giriḥ atha śrī kula antam nirṛtyām

analyzed: dīrghaiḥ yuktāḥ svaraiḥ tāḥ śaśadhara śakalaiḥ hrasva bindu svaraiḥ te

original: p / yuktāḥ syuścāsitāṅgo rururatha kathitaścaṇḍakaḥ krodhanākhya
analyzed: yuktāḥ syuḥ ca asitāṅgaḥ ruruḥ atha kathitaḥ caṇḍakaḥ krodhana ākhya
translated: They are also endowed with Asitanga, Ruru, Chandaka, Krodhana,

analyzed: śca unmattaḥ nyaḥ kapālī tadanu nigaditaḥ bhīṣaṇaḥ saṃhṛtiḥ ca
translated: The other one is Unmatta, Kapali, and then Bhisana, and Samharin is mentioned.

analyzed: tāra śrī yuta pīṭha nāma sahitaḥ pīṭha iti śabdaḥ
translated: The word seat is accompanied by the name of the seat united with Shri Tara, the long vowel,

analyzed: dīrghaḥ syāt atha mātṛnāma sahitam tat tat caturthyām tu hṛd

analyzed: hrasvāḥ bindu yutāḥ svarāḥ ca kathitāḥ nāmnā sitāṅga ādaya
translated: The short vowels along with the bindu are known as Sitanga and others,

analyzed: brahmāṇī ādyāḥ tu devyaḥ

translated: With a beautiful form full of the knowledge of the universe, the abode of all beauty and virtues, the all-pervading Lord.🔽Adorned with golden bracelets, armlets, and necklaces, with various bangles and rings,

translated: Whose pair of thighs is charming like the trunk of a plantain tree,🔽The beautiful one, with a beautiful waist marked by a girdle,

translated: Then, with the six limbs beginning with invocation, installation, and presence, as stated in the chapter on worship,

translated: Arghya, water for washing feet and mouth, along with scents, unbroken rice, flowers and incense should be offered to him with the heart mantra.

original: snānaṃ ṣaḍaṅgairapi mūlayuktairmantraiśca sūtrairapi vaidikaiḥ syāt // //🔽vastrāṇi mālyāni ca bhūṣaṇādyaṃ gandhākṣate cāpyatha dhūpadīpau /
analyzed: snānam ṣaḍaṅgaiḥ api mūla yuktaiḥ mantraiḥ ca sūtraiḥ api vaidikaiḥ syāt  vastrāṇi mālyāni ca bhūṣaṇa ādyam gandha akṣate ca api atha dhūpa dīpau
translated: The bath should be performed with the six limbs and the root mantras, as well as with the Vedic sutras.🔽Clothes, garlands, ornaments and the like, scents, unbroken rice, incense and lamps should be offered.

original: hṛdaiva dadyānmukuraṃ ca netrānmūlena naivedyamapi pradeyam // //
analyzed: hṛdā eva dadyāt mukuram ca netrāt mūlena naivedyam api pradeyam
translated: The mirror should be offered with the heart mantra, and the food offering should be given with the root mantra.

analyzed: tat ca uttamāt uttama pūrva mārgāt caturvidha anna ājya phala upadaṃśaiḥ  yuktam dadhi kṣaudra sita upala ājyaiḥ sa laḍḍukaiḥ modaka maṇḍaka ādyaiḥ
translated: And that should be of the best quality, with the best ingredients, and with four kinds of food, ghee and fruits as side dishes.🔽It should be accompanied by curd, honey, sugar-candy, ghee, laddukas, modakas, mandakas and so on.

original: śītaṃ jalaṃ sāmbu ca nārikelaṃ saktūṃśca lājān madhurān gulāktān /
analyzed: śītam jalam sa ambu ca nārikelam saktūn ca lājān madhurān gula aktān
translated: Cold water, coconut water, flour cakes, fried grain mixed with sweet honey,

original: pāṇyorjalaṃ cācamanaṃ ca dattvā tāmbūlamaṣṭāṅgayutaṃ nivedya // //
analyzed: pāṇyoḥ jalam ca ācamanam ca dattvā tāmbūlam aṣṭāṅga yutam nivedya
translated: and water for sipping should be offered in the hands, and betel nut along with the eight limbs should be offered.

original: phavoḍaṣāṃ vidmahe vakratuṇḍāya dhīmahi tanno gaṇapatiḥ pracodayāt /🔽gāyatrīyaṃ vighnarājasya yojyā naivedyādau japyahomādike ca /
analyzed: phavoḍaṣām vidmahe vakratuṇḍāya dhīmahi tat naḥ gaṇapatiḥ pracodayāt  gāyatrī iyam vighnarājasya yojyā naivedya ādau japya homa ādike ca
translated: We know the one with the pot-like belly, we meditate on the one with the crooked trunk, may the Lord of the Ganas inspire us.🔽This Gayatri of the Lord of Obstacles should be used in offerings of food etc., and in japa, homa etc.

original: stutvā stotrairdaṇḍavaccāpi natvā kakṣyāṃsaṃsthāḥ parṣadaścātra pūjyāḥ // //
analyzed: stutvā stotraiḥ daṇḍa vat ca api natvā kakṣyāṃsaṃsthāḥ parṣadaḥ ca atra pūjyāḥ  /
translated: Having praised with hymns and bowed down like a staff, the attendants stationed in the chambers and the assembly here should be worshipped.

original: padmo mahāpadmanidhiśca pūrve dvāre'tha yāmye makaraśca kūrmaḥ /
analyzed: padmaḥ mahā padma nidhiḥ ca pūrve yāmye makaraḥ ca kūrmaḥ
translated: Padma, Mahapadma, and Nidhi are in the east, Makara and Kurma are in the south,

analyzed: paścāt mukundaḥ nidhiḥ api anantaḥ pūjyaḥ tatas nīlanidhiḥ ca śaṅkhaḥ
translated: Mukunda and Ananta Nidhi are in the west, and Nila Nidhi and Sankha are in the north.

original: antarhāre bāhyato maṇḍapasya prācyāṃ yāmye paścime cottare ca /
analyzed: antarhāre bāhyatas maṇḍapasya prācyām yāmye paścime ca uttare ca
translated: Inside the outer pavilion, in the east, south, west and north,

analyzed: svarṇa ākārāḥ kalpavṛkṣāḥ tu pūjyāḥ catvāraḥ te ratna caityaiḥ nibaddhāḥ
translated: the four wish-fulfilling trees in the form of gold should be worshipped, bound with jeweled stupas.

original: te ca vilvāśvatthavaṭodumbarākārāḥ kalpavṛkṣā iti yāvat /
analyzed: te ca vilva aśvattha vaṭa udumbara ākārāḥ kalpavṛkṣāḥ iti yāvat
translated: And those are the wish-fulfilling trees in the form of bilva, ashvattha, vaṭa and udumbara.

original: p / bilvasyādhaḥ padmagatau śrīkamalākṣau sarvo gaurī dakṣiṇataḥ pippalamūle /
analyzed: bilvasya adhas padma gatau śrī kamala akṣau sarvaḥ gaurī dakṣiṇatas pippala mūle
translated: Below the bilva tree, on a lotus, Shri and Kamalaksha, to the right of all is Gauri at the root of the pippala tree.

original: nyagrodhādhaḥ kāmaratī paścimatastāṃ saumye kroḍo bhūśca tathodumbaramūle // //
analyzed: nyagrodha adhas kāmaratī paścimatas tām saumye kroḍaḥ bhūḥ ca tathā udumbara mūle
translated: Below the nyagrodha tree is Kamarati in the west, and to the north is Kroda and Bhu at the root of the udumbara tree.

original: padmau śaṅkhaṃ cakramatho ṭaṅkavaraiṇau dhyeyāḥ pāśaṃ cāṅkuśapuṣpeṣudhanūṃṣi /
analyzed: padmau śaṅkham cakram atho ṭaṅka vara eṇau dhyeyāḥ pāśam ca aṅkuśa puṣpa iṣu dhanūṃṣi
translated: The lotus, conch, discus, and the excellent staff, deer, noose, goad, flowers, arrows, and bow - these should be meditated upon.

analyzed: vibhrāṇāḥ te tu utpala pūga uttha gadā arīn śāli agra ālī kalpalatā iva krama śomī
translated: Holding these, they are like a row of wish-fulfilling creepers with the best of rice grains.

original: śrīmukundādayo'ṣṭau dvandvaśaḥ krameṇordhvakarābhyāṃ padmādīnyāyudhāni bibhrāṇāścādhaḥkarābhyāṃ baddhāñjalipuṭā lalitaveṣābharaṇādyalaṅkṛtā mitho dāmpatyaprītimavicchinnāṃ cirāya prārthayanto gaṇeśābhimukhaṃ padmeṣu sthitā dhyeyāḥ syuriti yāvat /
analyzed: śrī mukunda ādayaḥ uṣṭau dvandvaśas krameṇa ūrdhva karābhyām padma ādīni āyudhāni bibhrāṇāḥ ca adhas karābhyām baddhāñjali puṭāḥ lalita veṣa ābharaṇa ādi alaṅkṛtāḥ mithas dāmpatya prītim avicchinnām cirāya prārthayantaḥ gaṇeśa abhimukham padmeṣu sthitāḥ dhyeyāḥ syuḥ iti yāvat
translated: The eight, beginning with Mukunda, should be meditated upon as standing on lotuses, facing the lords of the Ganas, with their upper hands holding the weapons such as the lotus in pairs, and with their lower hands folded in reverence, adorned with charming dress, ornaments, etc., desiring uninterrupted conjugal love for a long time.

analyzed: dāmpatyānām madhya vidikṣu apsarasaḥ ntar gandharva ādyāḥ ca api atha vidyādhara siddhāḥ
translated: In the intermediate directions of the couples, the celestial nymphs, Gandharvas and others, and the Vidyadharas and Siddhas should be contemplated.

original: vahnyāśādyaṃ vāditagītaṃ sahanṛttaṃ tanvānāste sveṣṭaphalāptyai khalu cintyāḥ // //
analyzed: vahni āśā ādyam vādita gītam sahanṛttam tanvānāḥ te sva iṣṭa phala āptyai khalu cintyāḥ  /
translated: In the directions beginning with the southeast, they should be contemplated as playing musical instruments, singing, and dancing with their bodies, in order to attain their desired fruits.

original: teṣāṃ bāhye vedacaturgopurasaṃstho brāhmyā yuktaḥ kuṇḍikajapyāvalipāṇiḥ /
analyzed: teṣām bāhye veda catur gopura saṃsthaḥ brāhmyā yuktaḥ kuṇḍika japya āvali pāṇiḥ
translated: Outside them, Brahma, holding a water pot and rosary in his hands, should be placed in the four city gates, along with the Vedas.

original: padmāsīnaḥ pustakakumbhau ca dadhatyā śuklākalpaḥ paṅkajabhūḥ syādabhicintyaḥ // //
analyzed: padma āsīnaḥ pustaka kumbhau ca dadhatyā śuklā kalpaḥ paṅkaja bhūḥ syāt abhicintyaḥ  /
translated: Seated on a lotus, holding a book and a water pot, one should contemplate the white-complexioned one born from a lotus.

original: tatra gopurāṇāṃ madhye koṇeṣvāgneyādiṣu sanakādayo dakṣādayo bālakhilyāḥ saptarṣayaśca yathādhikāraṃ dhyāyantaḥ sukhāsīnāḥ smartavyāḥ /
analyzed: tatra gopurāṇām madhye koṇeṣu āgneya ādiṣu sanaka ādayaḥ dakṣa ādayaḥ bālakhilyāḥ saptarṣayaḥ ca yathādhikāram dhyāyantaḥ sukha āsīnāḥ smartavyāḥ
translated: There, in the middle of the city gates, in the southeast and other corners, Sanaka and others, Daksha and others, the Valakhilya sages and the seven sages should be remembered as seated comfortably, contemplating according to their authority.

original: tṛtīyahāre tvatha lokapālān yajet svadiksthān sagaṇān savāhān /
analyzed: tṛtīya hāre tu atha lokapālān yajet sva diś sthān sa gaṇān sa vāhān
translated: Then, in the third enclosure, one should worship the Lokapalas, along with their retinues and vehicles, stationed in their own directions.

original: yāmye pitṝnambupatau ca nāgān saumye dhaneśaṃ saha yakṣabṛndaiḥ // //
analyzed: yāmye pitṝn ambupatau ca nāgān saumye dhaneśam saha yakṣa bṛndaiḥ
translated: In the south, the ancestors, and in the west, the Nagas, in the north, Kubera with the Yaksha hosts,

analyzed: caturtha kakṣyā nilayān tu daityān sa dānavān tān sa sutān sa dārān
translated: One should worship the Daityas dwelling in the fourth enclosure, along with the Danavas, their sons and wives.

original: yajed ṛṣīnapyatha pañcamī yā vṛtistu tasyāṃ marutaśca sarvān // //
analyzed: yajet ṛṣīn api atha pañcamī yā vṛtiḥ tu tasyām marutaḥ ca sarvān
translated: And the sages, and then all the Maruts in the fifth enclosure.

original: ṣaṣṭhyāṃ vṛtāvuttarato guruṃ ca kṣetreśamabhyarcya navagrahāṃśca /🔽madhye raviṃ dikṣu śaśijñadhiṣṇyaiḥ śukraṃ kujādyānanalādikeṣu // //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhyām vṛtau uttaratas gurum ca kṣetra īśam abhyarcya nava grahān ca  madhye ravim dikṣu śaśi jña dhiṣṇyaiḥ śukram kuja ādyān anala ādikeṣu
translated: In the sixth enclosure, having worshipped the preceptor to the north, and the Kshetrapati, and the nine planets,🔽In the center, the sun, in the directions, the moon, Jupiter, Venus, Mars, etc., in the east, etc.

original: tasyāṃ grahān skandamukhāṃśca bhūyo bhūtāni mātṝśca yajed yathāvat /
analyzed: tasyām grahān skanda mukhān ca bhūyas bhūtāni mātṝḥ ca yajet yathāvat
translated: In that (enclosure), one should again duly worship the planets, Skanda and others, the beings, and the Mothers.

analyzed: divya adhi varṣa ambudhi vāsinaḥ ye vicintyāḥ
translated: The divine beings, the serpent-spirits, the water-spirits, and the Kinnaras, who dwell in the heavens, on the earth, in the waters, and in the mountains, should be contemplated as occupying the last enclosure.

original: evaṃ bahiḥ sapta yathoktakakṣyāvāsāstu ye dampatikalpavṛkṣāḥ /
analyzed: evam bahis sapta yathā ukta kakṣyā vāsāḥ tu ye dampati kalpavṛkṣāḥ
translated: Thus, the seven external enclosures are occupied by the trees of the couples, as described.

analyzed: deva ādayaḥ prokta gaṇāḥ yathāvat pūjyāḥ gaṇeśa arcana tatparāḥ te
translated: The gods and other groups mentioned should be worshipped as appropriate, those who are devoted to the worship of Ganesha.

analyzed: pañca upacāraiḥ tu yathā upapattyā svaiḥ nāmabhiḥ pūjanam uktam eṣām
translated: The worship of these is said to be done with their own names, by the five modes of service, as available.

analyzed: vahnau api ittham sa gaṇam gaṇeśam santarpayet ājya nivedya śeṣaiḥ
translated: In the fire also, one should offer oblations to Ganesha and his attendants with the remaining ghee and offerings.

original: mudrāstu śaṅkhārimukhāḥ pradarśyā bāhuṃ mukhe hastikaropamānam /
analyzed: mudrāḥ tu śaṅkha ari mukhāḥ pradarśyāḥ bāhum mukhe hasti kara upamānam
translated: Displaying the mudras of the conch, sword, etc., and placing the hand resembling an elephant's trunk in the mouth,

analyzed: vinyasya saṅkuñcita madhyama agram aṅguṣṭha yuktam gaṇarāja mudrāḥ
translated: with the middle finger bent, and the thumb joined, are the mudras of the king of the Ganas.

original: tato yathāśakti japecca nityaṃ japaṃ ca pūjāṃ culukodakena /
analyzed: tatas yathāśakti japet ca nityam japam ca pūjām culuka udakena
translated: Then, one should perform the daily japa to the best of one's ability, and offer the japa and worship with water from the ritual vessel,

analyzed: nivedayet aṅghri saroruhe sya krameṇa mantraiḥ iha vakṣyamāṇaiḥ
translated: to the lotus feet of Ganesha, in sequence, with the mantras to be mentioned here.

analyzed: om
translated: Om🔽🔽

analyzed: guhya ati guhya goptā tvam gṛhāṇa asmad kṛtam japam
translated: You are the protector of the most secret secrets, please accept the japa performed by us.

original: siddhirbhavati me yena tvatprasādāt tvayi sthitā // //
analyzed: siddhiḥ bhavati me yena tvad prasādāt tvayi sthitā  /
translated: By your grace, may I attain perfection, abiding in you.

analyzed: yat kiñcid kurmahe deva sadā sukṛta duṣkṛtam
translated: Whatever good or bad deeds we do, O Lord,

analyzed: tat me śiva pada sthasya bhuṅkṣva kṣapaya śaṅkara  /
translated: May you enjoy and destroy them all, O Śaṅkara, while I remain at the feet of Śiva.

original: śivo dātā śivo bhoktā śivaḥ sarvamidaṃ jagat /
analyzed: śivaḥ dātā śivaḥ bhoktā śivaḥ sarvam idam jagat
translated: Śiva is the giver, Śiva is the enjoyer, Śiva is this entire universe.

original: śivo jayati sarvatra yaḥ śivaḥ so'hameva tu // //
analyzed: śivaḥ jayati sarvatra yaḥ śivaḥ saḥ aham eva tu
translated: Śiva is victorious everywhere. He who is Śiva, I am indeed he.

original: yeyaṃ pūjā kṛtā deva / japahomānvitā mayā /
analyzed: yā iyam pūjā kṛtā deva japa homa anvitā mayā
translated: O Lord, this worship along with japa and oblations that I have performed,

analyzed: prasīda pratigṛhṇīṣva siddhim iṣṭām prayaccha me
translated: Be pleased, accept it and grant me the desired perfection.

analyzed: tatas samādhāya hiraṇyaretasam yathā ukta saṃskāra viśeṣa saṃskṛtam
translated: Then, having purified the golden semen as prescribed,

original: dvijastu hutvāgnimukhaṃ ca tanmukhe gaṇeśamāvāhya juhotu siddhaye // //
analyzed: dvijaḥ tu hutvā agni mukham ca tad mukhe gaṇeśam āvāhya juhotu siddhaye
translated: The twice-born should offer oblations into the fire and invoke Gaṇeśa in front of it for the sake of accomplishment.

analyzed: dhavala kusuma gandhaḥ paurṇamāsī ādi hutvā ghṛta gula madhu yuktam puṇḍarīka ayutāni
translated: Having offered white flowers and incense on the full moon day, along with ghee, jaggery, and honey, and ten thousand lotus flowers,

original: ghṛtamadhupayasā vā śrīphalairardhalakṣaṃ dhanapatiriva lakṣmīmakṣayāṃ vindate'sau // //
analyzed: ghṛta madhu payasā vā śrīphalaiḥ ardha lakṣam dhanapatiḥ iva lakṣmīm akṣayām vindate asau  /
translated: Or with ghee, honey, milk, or bilva fruits, one hundred thousand times, one attains imperishable prosperity like the lord of wealth.

analyzed: śuklām tu pratipadam āditaḥ tri rātram vā upoṣya trimadhura paṅkajaiḥ caturthyām
translated: Having fasted for three nights or one night, starting from the first day of the bright fortnight, on the fourth day, with the three sweet things and lotuses,

original: hutvāgnāvayutamathādhikaṃ ca lakṣaṃ lakṣmīṃ vā nidhimapi paśyatīti satyam // //
analyzed: hutvā agnau ayutam atha adhikam ca lakṣam lakṣmīm vā nidhim api paśyati iti satyam
translated: Having offered one hundred thousand oblations in the fire, and then one hundred thousand more, it is true that one will see Lakshmi or a treasure.

original: nandyāvartairvā bhagarkṣe sahasraiḥ pañcamyāṃ vā puṇḍarīkākṣapuṣpaiḥ /
analyzed: nandyāvartaiḥ vā bhaga ṛkṣe sahasraiḥ pañcamyām vā puṇḍarīkākṣa puṣpaiḥ
translated: Or with Nandya-varta flowers on a Tuesday, or with white lotus flowers on the fifth day,

original: dvādaśyāṃ vā śuklaparvaṇyathaivaṃ hutvā śvetaiḥ paṅkajaiḥ syād dhaneśaḥ // //
analyzed: dvādaśyām vā śukla parvaṇi atha evam hutvā śvetaiḥ paṅkajaiḥ syāt dhaneśaḥ  /
translated: Or on the twelfth day of the bright fortnight, having offered oblations in this way with white lotuses, one will become the lord of wealth.

original: nityaṃ prāhṇe vordhvabāhurjapitvā yāvallakṣaṃ sūryadṛṣṭirdhanī syāt /
analyzed: nityam prāhṇe vā ūrdhva bāhuḥ japitvā yāvat lakṣam sūrya dṛṣṭiḥ dhanī syāt
translated: Always in the morning, with uplifted arms, having muttered as long as one hundred thousand times, with eyes fixed on the sun, one will become wealthy.

original: utpāṭyāthodumbaraṃ vāpyaśeṣaṃ hutvā lakṣmīṃ vindate maṇḍalena // //
analyzed: utpāṭya atha udumbaram vā api aśeṣam hutvā lakṣmīm vindate maṇḍalena
translated: Having uprooted an entire Udumbara tree, having offered oblations with it, one obtains Lakshmi by means of a circle.

original: p / ekacchāyāpatyagokṣīrasiddhaṃ spṛṣṭvābhyastaṃ taccaruṃ prāśayed vā /
analyzed: ekacchāyā apatya go kṣīra siddham spṛṣṭvā abhyastam tat carum prāśayet vā
translated: Or having touched the rice boiled in the milk of a cow that has a calf of the same color, and having eaten that rice repeatedly,

original: pārāvāraṃgāminīsindhutoye bhānuṃ paśyan vā japan syāddhaneśaḥ // //
translated: Or looking at the sun in the water of the river that flows from the ocean, while muttering, one will become the lord of wealth.

analyzed: nālikreḥ apanasa ekṣava rambhā saktu lāja pṛthukaiḥ madhura aktaiḥ
translated: With the flour of Narikela, Panasa, Ikshu, and Rambha, mixed with honey,

original: modakaiśca sahitaistu samāṃśairhoma eṣa khalu kalpakavṛkṣaḥ // //
analyzed: modakaiḥ ca sahitaiḥ tu sama aṃśaiḥ homaḥ eṣa khalu kalpaka vṛkṣaḥ
translated: And with sweetmeats, all in equal parts, this oblation is indeed the wish-fulfilling tree.

analyzed: hutvā a chidrān ūrṇa nābheḥ tu tantūn vastra artham vā śukla rakta ādi puṣpaiḥ
translated: Having offered oblations with the threads of a flawless woolen cloth, or with white, red, and other flowers, for the sake of cloth,

analyzed: tad tad varṇāni āpnuyāt kairavaiḥ vā vāsāṃsi abjaiḥ śobhanaiḥ śobhanāni
translated: One should obtain those respective colors with white lotuses or with beautiful garments and lotuses.

analyzed: kṣīra ājyābhyām sikta dūrvā sahasram hutvā nityam syāt arogaḥ cira āyuḥ
translated: By offering one thousand Durva grass blades sprinkled with milk and ghee, one will always be free from disease and have long life.

original: puṣpaiḥ puṣṭiḥ syāt tilairājyamiśraiḥ pītvābhyastaṃ vāri rogān nihanyāt // //🔽caturaṅgulamātramitāḥ suhutāḥ praharantyamṛtālatikāsamidhaḥ /
analyzed: puṣpaiḥ puṣṭiḥ syāt tilaiḥ ājya miśraiḥ pītvā abhyastam vāri rogān nihanyāt  / catur aṅgula mātra mitāḥ su hutāḥ praharanti amṛtā latikā samidhaḥ
translated: By offering flowers mixed with sesame seeds and ghee, one will obtain prosperity. By drinking water mixed with sesame seeds and ghee, one will destroy diseases.🔽The Samidh twigs of the Amrita creeper, when well offered to the length of four fingers,

original: dadhimadhvabhiyuktaghṛtasnapitāstvapamṛtyubhayaṃ grahadoṣamapi // //🔽saghṛtaṃ sasitaṃ paramānnahutaṃ saghṛtaṃ tu payaḥ saha kṛṣṇatilaiḥ /
analyzed: dadhi madhu abhiyukta ghṛta snapitāḥ tu apamṛtyu bhayam graha doṣam api  sa ghṛtam sa sitam paramānna hutam sa ghṛtam tu payaḥ saha kṛṣṇa tilaiḥ
translated: When anointed with ghee and honey mixed with curd, remove the fear of untimely death and the faults of planets.🔽Ghee mixed with sugar, the best food offering, ghee mixed with milk, along with black sesame seeds,

original: asitāhani pippalamūlajapo'pyabhimṛśya haredapamṛtyubhiyam // //🔽kalaśaṃ tu raverudaye'bjagataṃ parijapya divā niśi jāgaraṇāt /
analyzed: asita ahani pippala mūla japaḥ upi abhimṛśya haret apamṛtyu bhiyam  kalaśam tu parijapya divā niśi jāgaraṇāt
translated: And the root of Pippala, when touched, removes the fear of untimely death.🔽The water pot, placed in a lotus, should be enchanted at sunrise, during the day and at night while awake,

original: udaye tu reverabhiṣicya jayed duritānyabhicārarujo'pi haret // //
analyzed: udaye tu reveḥ abhiṣicya jayet duritāni abhicāra rujaḥ api haret
translated: And when sprinkled at sunrise, one will conquer calamities and remove the evil effects of sorcery.

analyzed: udaye paripūrya tathā kalaśam ghṛta homa daśa aṃśaka śeṣa yutam
translated: The water pot, filled in the same way, with the remaining tenth part of ghee offerings,

original: dinamadhyagate tapane snapanāt subhagastu samṛddhisutān labhate // //
analyzed: dina madhya gate tapane snapanāt subhagaḥ tu samṛddhi sutān labhate  /
translated: If one bathes at midday when the sun is shining, one will become fortunate and obtain wealth and children.

original: salilānnaphalādi caredamunā parijapya tu rogaharaṃ vacasām /
analyzed: salila anna phala ādi caret amunā parijapya tu roga haram vacasām
translated: One should offer water, food, fruits, etc. while reciting this mantra. It removes diseases of speech.

original: vibhavaṃ vitanoti ca dattamidaṃ priyakūrcamatho janarañjanakam // //
analyzed: vibhavam vitanoti ca dattam idam priya kūrcam atho jana rañjanakam
translated: When given, it bestows prosperity and delights people.

original: brāhme kāle parvaṇi kṣīṇacandre pādme patre kāpilaṃ gomayaṃ khe /
analyzed: brāhme kāle parvaṇi kṣīṇa candre pādme patre kāpilam gomayam khe
translated: At Brahma time, on a parva day, when the moon is waning, one should obtain cow dung from a Kapila cow on a lotus leaf in the sky.

original: labdhvābhyastaṃ cāyutaṃ tannikhātaṃ dvāre rekṣed rogacorāgnyahibhyaḥ // //🔽tadvad vahnau gomayād bhasma siddhaṃ sāpasmārān kṣudrabhūtagrahādīn /
analyzed: labdhvā abhyastam ca ayutam tat nikhātam dvāre rekṣet roga cora agni ahibhyaḥ  tadvat vahnau gomayāt bhasma siddham sa apasmārān kṣudra bhūta graha ādīn
translated: Having recited it ten thousand times, if one places it at the door, one will be protected from disease, thieves, fire, and snakes.🔽Similarly, ash produced from cow dung in a fire, along with epilepsy, small evil spirits, and so on,

original: hanyād rakṣāṃ cāvahecchrīkaraṃ tanmantrālabdhaṃ candanādyaṃ ca vaśyam // //
analyzed: hanyāt rakṣām ca āvahet śrīkaram tad mantra ālabdham candana ādyam ca vaśyam
translated: will destroy them and bring protection. That which is obtained with the mantra, such as sandalwood, etc., is under control.

analyzed: tisraḥ rātrīḥ prāk upoṣya uparāge brahmī sarpiḥ tāmra pātre vacāyāḥ
translated: Having fasted for three nights before an eclipse, the ghee of Brahmi in a copper vessel mixed with the powder of Vacha,
obtained with the mantra of Hamsa Vagishvari, bestows eloquence.

analyzed: vṛṣṭiḥ bhavet vetasa jābhiḥ iṣṭā tri patra jābhiḥ ca sutāḥ samidbhiḥ
translated: If one offers oblations of twigs from a three-leaved tree, rain will fall. If one offers oblations of twigs from a Vetasa tree, one will obtain sons.

analyzed: hutvā kaṇaiḥ vārayati iha vṛṣṭim tathā arka puṣpaiḥ madhuraiḥ jayam ca
translated: By offering oblations with grains, one can ward off rain here, and with sweet arka flowers, one can obtain victory.

original: p / annena cānnaṃ madhuraistu vindet palāśakaudumbarabodhijābhiḥ /
analyzed: annena ca annam madhuraiḥ tu vindet palāśa kaudumbara bodhi jābhiḥ
translated: And by offering oblations with food, one can obtain food, and with sweet offerings, one can obtain the colors of the palasha, udumbara, and bodhi trees.

original: plakṣodbhavābhirhavanāt samidbhiḥ krameṇa varṇān vaśayed dvijādīn // //🔽vailvaiḥ phalaiḥ sarasijaiśca nṛpā vaśe syuḥ śvetotpalairjanapadā lavaṇājyalājaiḥ /
analyzed: plakṣa udbhavābhiḥ havanāt samidbhiḥ krameṇa varṇān vaśayet dvija ādīn  vailvaiḥ phalaiḥ sarasijaiḥ ca nṛpāḥ vaśe syuḥ śveta utpalaiḥ janapadāḥ lavaṇa ājya lājaiḥ
translated: By offering oblations with sticks born from the plaksha tree, one can successively subjugate the colors of Brahmins and others.🔽By offering oblations with bilva fruits and lotus flowers, kings will be under one's control, with white lotuses, the people of the country, with salt, ghee, and fried grain,

original: kanyāḥ saloṇamadhunā havanāt striyo'nyān grāmān niśāhvatilataṇḍulaśarkarābhiḥ // //
analyzed: kanyāḥ sa loṇa madhunā havanāt striyaḥ nyān grāmān niśāhva tila taṇḍula śarkarābhiḥ  /
translated: with salt and honey, other women, and with sesame seeds, rice, and sugar, one can obtain villages.

original: rājñāṃ tu śatruvijayāya viśiṣṭadeśe kṛtvā tu maṇḍavaraṃ caturaśraśālam /
analyzed: rājñām tu śatru vijayāya viśiṣṭa deśe kṛtvā tu maṇḍa varam caturaśra śālam
translated: For the victory over enemies of kings, in an excellent place, one should construct a square hall with a pavilion,

original: digdvāratoraṇayutaṃ samalaṅkṛtaṃ tat sañchādya sūkṣmavasanaiḥ phalapuṣpamālyaiḥ // //
analyzed: diś dvāra toraṇa yutam samalaṅkṛtam tat sañchādya sūkṣma vasanaiḥ phala puṣpa mālyaiḥ
translated: decorated with gates and arches in the four directions, covered with fine clothes, fruit, flowers, and garlands.

original: tat svastikāmbujagataṃ gaṇanāthamiṣṭvā kuṇḍe juhotu madhuratritayena lakṣam /
analyzed: tat svastika ambuja gatam gaṇanātham iṣṭvā kuṇḍe juhotu madhura tritayena lakṣam
translated: Having worshipped Ganesha, the lord of obstacles, in a pit, one should offer one lakh oblations with the three sweet things.

analyzed: bhakṣyaiḥ ca modaka phalaiḥ api tad daśa aṃśam kṣīraudana aikṣava ghṛtaiḥ tri sahasra saṃkhyam
translated: And with food, sweets, and fruits, one-tenth of that, and with milk, rice, sugarcane, ghee, and sesame seeds, three thousand times.

original: mṛṣṭānnahemavasanaṃ prathamāśramibhyo dattvā gavāśvakanakāni tathaiva hotuḥ /
analyzed: mṛṣṭa anna hema vasanam prathama āśramibhyaḥ dattvā gavāśva kanakāni tathā eva hotuḥ
translated: Having given to the first hermits delicious food, gold, and garments, and likewise cows, horses, and gold to the Hotri priest,

original: santarpya ca dvijavarāṃstridaśānapīṣṭvā yāsyan sa hi bhaved vijayī narendraḥ // //
analyzed: santarpya ca dvijavarān tridaśān api iṣṭvā yāsyan sa hi bhavet vijayī narendraḥ  /
translated: and having satisfied the best of Brahmins and even the gods, that king who is about to depart would be victorious.

original: tenābhyastāḥ śarkarāḥ sarpadasyūn vyāghrādīn vā vāraṇān vārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: tena abhyastāḥ śarkarāḥ sarpa dasyūn vyāghra ādīn vā vāraṇān vārayeyuḥ
translated: The pebbles practiced by him would ward off serpents, thieves, tigers, etc., or elephants.

original: agniṃ haste dhārayejjambhakādīn rakṣoyakṣān bhūtavargāṃśca hanyāt // //
analyzed: agnim haste dhārayet jambhaka ādīn rakṣaḥ yakṣān bhūta vargān ca hanyāt
translated: He should hold fire in his hand and slay the Rakshasas, Yakshas, and groups of spirits such as Jambhaka, etc.

original: ākṛṣyātho yoṣitaṃ nartayedvā lokaṃ sarvaṃ kṣobhayenmantrasiddhaḥ /
analyzed: ākṛṣya atho yoṣitam nartayet vā lokam sarvam kṣobhayet mantra siddhaḥ
translated: Having attracted a woman, he should make her dance, or having accomplished the mantra, he should agitate the entire world.

original: tenābhyastaṃ kajjalaṃ candanaṃ vā prītiṃ hṛdyāmāvahellocanānām // //
analyzed: tena abhyastam kajjalam candanam vā prītim hṛdyām āvahet locanānām
translated: The collyrium or sandal practiced by him would bring about pleasing delight to the eyes.

original: yat siddhārthairmantritaiḥ prāk sahasramaśvatthāntaḥ sthāpitaiḥ saptarātram /
analyzed: yat siddhārthaiḥ mantritaiḥ prāk sahasram aśvattha antar sthāpitaiḥ sapta rātram
translated: What is accomplished by the Siddha-arthas (accomplished objects) consecrated with mantras and placed inside the Asvattha tree for seven nights,

original: paunaḥpunyaṃ tajjapāt sādhitaistaiḥ śatrūn sarpāṃścāṭayet tatra khātaiḥ // //
analyzed: paunaḥpunyam tad japāt sādhitaiḥ taiḥ śatrūn sarpān ca āṭayet tatra khātaiḥ
translated: and again accomplished by those repeated recitations, by digging there with those, he should drive away enemies and serpents.

analyzed: dveṣayet kali samidbhiḥ atha anyān vā tuṣa antarita nimba dalaiḥ ca
translated: He should cause enmity with other Kali Sami wood, or with Nimba leaves covered with chaff.

analyzed: caityaka anala vibhīta samidbhiḥ mārayet sapadi rakta viṣābhyām
translated: With the twigs of Chaitya, Kanala, and Vibhitaka, one can quickly destroy both blood and black magic.

analyzed: ati rakta kṛṣṇam abhicintya vibhum vana darbha puñjam abhimantrya samam
translated: Contemplating the all-pervading Lord, extremely red and black, and incanting an equal bundle of wild darbha grass,

analyzed: puruṣa pramāṇam atha śatru pathe vikiret tu rogam upayānti arayaḥ
translated: One should scatter it in the enemy's path. Then the enemies will fall ill.

analyzed: rasanā gatam pradahat agni nibham prativādinaḥ gaṇa patim smaratu
translated: Remembering Ganesha, the lord of the Ganas, burning like fire in the throat of the opponent,

original: prajapan manuṃ śitatadaṅkuśato lavanena taṃ jayati ruddhamukham // //
analyzed: prajapan manum śita tad aṅkuśataḥ lavanena tam jayati ruddha mukham
translated: Reciting the mantra, he conquers him with a sharp goad, his mouth blocked.

original: tṛtīyāmupoṣyātha mantrī caturthyāṃ svaśaktyā tu hutvā tathāgnau phalādyaiḥ /
analyzed: tṛtīyām upoṣya atha mantrī caturthyām sva śaktyā tu hutvā tathā agnau phala ādyaiḥ
translated: Then the reciter, fasting on the third day, should offer oblations in the fire on the fourth day according to his ability, with fruits etc.

original: payonnaṃ ghṛtāḍhyaṃ nivedyāsya bhaktyā dvijendrāṃstatheṣṭvā svabhīṣṭaṃ sa vindet // //
analyzed: payaḥ nam ghṛta āḍhyam nivedya asya bhaktyā dvijendrān tathā iṣṭvā su abhīṣṭam sa vindet  /
translated: Having offered milk, rice, and ghee to him with devotion, and having worshipped the best of Brahmins, he will obtain his desired object.

original: payo vātha śākaṃ samaśnaṃstu lakṣaṃ japed yaḥ sa siddhiṃ samagrāmupeyāt /
analyzed: payaḥ vā atha śākam samaśnan tu lakṣam japet yaḥ sa siddhim samagrām upeyāt
translated: One who recites the mantra one lakh times, eating milk or vegetables, will attain complete success.

analyzed: dvijāgryān abhīṣṭaiḥ vaṭūn ca iṣṭa dānaiḥ ajasram sva śaktyā yajet ca api vindet  /
translated: And he should constantly worship the best of Brahmins with desired gifts according to his ability. He will also obtain success.

original: p / atrocyate kuṇḍavarasya tu prāguktasvarūpaṃ gaṇanāthamiṣṭvā /
analyzed: atra ucyate kuṇḍa varasya tu prāc ukta svarūpam gaṇanātham iṣṭvā
translated: Here it is said: Having worshipped Ganesha, whose form was described earlier, the best of the Kundas,

analyzed: kuṇḍe agnim ādhāya payaḥ ghṛtābhyām arkasya puṣpaiḥ api vālukābhiḥ
translated: Having placed the fire in a pit, and having offered oblations of milk, ghee, flowers of the sun, sand,

original: kṣaudreṇa cānnena pṛthak krameṇa hutvā tu lakṣāṇyatha kuṇḍamadhye /
analyzed: kṣaudreṇa ca annena pṛthak krameṇa hutvā tu lakṣāṇi atha kuṇḍa madhye
translated: Honey, and cooked rice separately in order, one hundred thousand times in the middle of the pit,

original: vetālasaṃjñāṃ gulikāṃ labhet tāṃ dhārayan syādaṇimādisiddhaḥ // //
analyzed: vetāla saṃjñām gulikām labhet tām dhārayan syāt aṇima ādi siddhaḥ
translated: One will obtain the pill known as Vetala. Wearing it, one becomes endowed with the powers of becoming small at will, etc.

original: evaṃ hi khaḍgāñjanapādukādyaṃ yad tat tadiṣṭaṃ labhate sma mantrī /
analyzed: evam hi khaḍga añjana pādukā ādyam yat tat tat iṣṭam labhate sma mantrī
translated: Thus, the mantra-reciting adept obtains whatever is desired, such as swords, collyrium, sandals, etc.

original: kiṃ tanna labhyaṃ bhuvanatraye'smin nāstyasya kiṃ vā bahunoditena // //🔽śālipiṣṭakadalīphalamāṣakṣodaśarkarasanistuṣamudgaiḥ /
analyzed: kim tat na labhyam bhuvanatraye ismin na asti asya kim vā bahunā uditena  śāli piṣṭa kadalī phala māṣa kṣoda śarkarasa nistuṣa mudgaiḥ
translated: What is not obtainable in these three worlds? Or what is the use of speaking much?🔽With rice flour, plantain fruit, black gram powder, sugar, husked green gram,

analyzed: nālikera madhu jīraka loṇaiḥ vyoṣa cūrṇa sahitam ghṛta siddhaiḥ
translated: Coconut, honey, cumin seeds, salt, and trikatu powder mixed with ghee,

analyzed: modakaiḥ hṛdaya modaka gandha svādubhiḥ pratidinam nija śaktyā
translated: These sweets, fragrant and tasty, delighting the heart, should be offered daily according to one's ability.

original: homa eṣa kila kalpakavṛkṣo vāñchitārthaphalado hi narāṇām // //🔽śālitaṇḍulasanistuṣamudgaiḥ sārdhaśarkaraghṛtairapi siddham /
analyzed: homaḥ eṣa kila kalpaka vṛkṣaḥ vāñchita artha phala daḥ hi narāṇām  śāli taṇḍula sa nistuṣa mudgaiḥ sārdha śarkara ghṛtaiḥ api siddham
translated: This oblation is indeed the wish-fulfilling tree, the bestower of the desired fruits to men.🔽Cooked with husked green gram, along with sugar and ghee,

analyzed: nālikera kapilā payasoḥ yat pāyasam hutam abhīṣṭa dam uktam
translated: The payasam made with coconut and cow's milk, when offered as oblation, is said to bestow the desired fruits.

analyzed: kadalī panasa āmra gostanīnām badarāṇām madhura traya ukṣitānām
translated: The oblation of plantains, jackfruit, mango, and jujube fruits, mixed with the three sweet things,

analyzed: api laḍḍu kamaṇḍaka ādikānām havanam kṛṣṇa tilaiḥ ca kāma dam syāt
translated: And with black sesame seeds, will grant all desires, along with apilundukas, mandakas, and other offerings.

analyzed: caturthika arcana hute vibhava anurūpam nitya arcanam ca gagana abja sudhā maya adbhiḥ
translated: The oblation of worship on the fourth day, according to one's means, and the daily worship with the waters of the sky-lotus nectar,

original: santarpaṇaṃ ca sakalābhimatāni puṃsāṃ saṃsādhayanti nikhilānyapi vāñchitāni // //
analyzed: santarpaṇam ca sakala abhimatāni puṃsām saṃsādhayanti nikhilāni api vāñchitāni
translated: The satisfaction, and all the desired things of men, or all the desired things, accomplish them.

analyzed: dhyātaḥ śaśāṅka dhavala dyutiḥ eṣa devaḥ sva aikyena hasta caṣaka amṛta vāri varṣaiḥ
translated: This god, meditated upon, with the radiance white like the moon, by becoming one with him, with the nectar-water in the hand-vessel,

original: siñcan viṣāṇi nikhilāni nihanti sadyo japtvā prapañcamayavigrahavighnarājaḥ // //
analyzed: siñcan viṣāṇi nikhilāni nihanti sadyas japtvā prapañca maya vigraha vighna rājaḥ
translated: Sprinkling, he immediately destroys all poisons. By reciting, the lord of obstacles with a body of the manifest world,
In the lotus of the heart, with a form delightful like the clear beauty of a fresh white lotus, with the radiance of a thousand moons,

original: aṅguṣṭhamātratanurūrdhvasudhāmbusikto dhyātaśca mṛtyumapi hanti vimuktidaḥ syāt // //
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha mātra tanuḥ ūrdhva sudhā ambu siktaḥ dhyātaḥ ca mṛtyum api hanti vimukti daḥ syāt  /
translated: With a body the size of a thumb, sprinkled with the nectar water above, meditated upon, he destroys even death and would give liberation.

original: itīha khalu kīrtito manurayaṃ prapañce yathā
analyzed: iti iha khalu kīrtitaḥ manuḥ ayam prapañce yathā
translated: Thus, indeed, this Manu has been declared here, as in the world,

analyzed: tathā ca lalitāgame makuṭavātule tu uditaḥ
translated: And in the Lalitāgama, in the Mukutāvataṃsa, it has been proclaimed.

analyzed: prapañca gaṇa nāyakaḥ tu
translated: The leader of the Prapañca Gaṇas, with his prescribed mantras and rituals,

analyzed: strivarga vibhava arthinām kali yuge api siddhi pradaḥ  iti śrīmat īśāna śiva guru deva paddhatau tantrasāre
translated: Bestows accomplishment even in the Kali Yuga to those who seek the prosperity of the three goals.🔽Thus ends the fifteenth chapter in the Tantrasāra of the illustrious Īśānaśivagurudeva's Paddhati,

analyzed: prapañca gaṇapati paṭalaḥ pañcadaśaḥ
translated: on Prapañca Gaṇapati.

analyzed: atha ṣoḍaśa paṭalaḥ  tāra śrī śakti kāma kṣiti gaṇapatayaḥ bīja bhūtāḥ ṣaṣ ādau
translated: Now, the sixteenth chapter.

original: caṇḍānto nāntaḍāntāvaṣaḍiratha marudyonigo'mbhaśca raktam /🔽toyaṃ vahnistadā tristadanu ca kathitaḥ sarvaśabdo janaṃ me
analyzed: caṇḍāntaḥ nānta ḍāntau aṣaḍiḥ atha marut yoni gombhaḥ ca raktam  toyam vahniḥ tadā tris tadanu ca kathitaḥ sarva śabdaḥ janam me
translated: Tārā, Śrī, Śakti, Kāma, Kṣiti, Gaṇapati are the seed syllables at the beginning, ending with Caṇḍa, ending with Na, ending with Ḍa, with Aṣṭa, Aṭa, Maru, Yoni, Go, and Water is red.

analyzed: mantraḥ vaināyakaḥ ūyam vaśam iti ca pada ādānayā agni priya antaḥ  /
translated: Water, Fire, then Three, then all the words are told after that, the mantra is this of Gaṇeśa, and the word Vasa, with the end of Āgnipriyā.

original: prāgvad bījaistārakādyaistu ṣaḍbhirvaighnaṃ bījaṃ tat tu dīrghasvarāḍhyam /
analyzed: prāgvat bījaiḥ tārakā ādyaiḥ tu ṣaḍbhiḥ vaighnam bījam tat tu dīrgha svara āḍhyam
translated: As before, with the seed syllables beginning with Tārā, the six, the Gaṇeśa seed syllable is endowed with long vowels,

original: yuktaṃ svāmirjātibhiḥ ṣaḍ yathāvadaṅgāni syustāni cāstrāntamārgāt // //
analyzed: yuktam svāmiḥ jātibhiḥ ṣaḍ yathāvat aṅgāni syuḥ tāni ca astra anta mārgāt
translated: United with the six lordly jātis, as appropriate, and the limbs are from the path ending with the weapon.

original: ṛṣistathokto gaṇakaḥ kakup syācchandastu gāyatramitīha kecit /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ tathā uktaḥ gaṇakaḥ kakubh syāt chandaḥ tu gāyatram iti iha kecid
translated: The sage is said to be the reckoner, the Kakup meter, and the Gayatri meter is said to be here by some.

analyzed: tad daivatam ca api mahā gaṇeśaḥ siddhiḥ caturvarga phala avasānā
translated: And the deity of that is the great Gaṇeśa, and the accomplishment is the attainment of the fourfold goal.

original: bhavābhāvabhāvaprasaṃkhyaṃ japet tatsamartho na ced bhāvabhāvābhasaṅkhyam /
analyzed: bhava abhāva bhāva prasaṃkhyam japet tat samarthaḥ na ced bhāva bhāva ābha saṅkhyam
translated: If one is not able to do the repetition of the mantra bhāvabhāvābhā one should do the repetition of bhāvabhāvābhā.

original: daśāṃśaṃ ca hutvā ghṛtaṃ cāṣṭamakṣyairbhavet siddhamantro gaṇeśaprabhāvaḥ // //
analyzed: daśa aṃśam ca hutvā ghṛtam ca aṣṭa makṣyaiḥ bhavet siddha mantraḥ gaṇeśa prabhāvaḥ
translated: Having offered oblations equal to one-tenth of that, and having offered ghee in the eight-petaled lotus, one becomes successful in the mantra, and attains the power of Gaṇeśa.

analyzed: haimam nānā vṛkṣa ṣaṇḍa abhirāmam śailam madhye gaula ratnākarasya
translated: One should meditate on a golden mountain in the middle of the ocean of jewels, delightful with various trees and groves.

analyzed: dhyāyet tasmin hema vapra āvṛta antam divya udyānam candrakānta sthala antam
translated: In that, one should meditate on a divine garden, the end of which is covered with golden ramparts, and the end of which is a ground of moonstone.

original: sthale'trātha madhye ṣaḍaśre tu pīṭhe gajāsyaṃ saroje purokte niviṣṭam /
analyzed: madhye ṣaṣ aśre tu pīṭhe gajāsyam saroje purā ukte niviṣṭam
translated: In the middle of this ground, on a six-sided seat, one should visualize the elephant-faced Gaṇeśa, seated on a lotus as described before,

original: japābhaṃ mahāntaṃ satundaṃ gaṇeśaṃ vicitraiḥ saratnaiśca hārairupetam // //
analyzed: japa ābham mahāntam sa tundam gaṇeśam vicitraiḥ sa ratnaiḥ ca hāraiḥ upetam
translated: of the color of jasmine, large, with a protruding belly, endowed with various jeweled necklaces,

analyzed: bījapūraka gadā smara hetīḥ aṅkuśa ari jalajāni api pāśam
translated: holding a citron, a mace, a lotus, a goad, a water lily, a noose,

original: utpalaṃ ca kalamānikaraṃ vo yo radaṃ daśabhujo dadhadavyāt // //
analyzed: utpalam ca kalamā nikaram vaḥ yaḥ radam daśa bhujaḥ dadhat avyāt
translated: and an utpala flower, and a bunch of sugarcane, may the ten-armed one protect me.

analyzed: savyam aṅkam adhiropita śaktyā śveta padma karayā su avagūḍham
translated: Embraced by his consort, who is seated on his right lap, holding a white lotus in her hand,

analyzed: gaura hāra maṇi hema vicitraiḥ bhūṣaṇaiḥ alam alaṅkṛta gātryā  rakta gandha kusuma ambara mālyaiḥ bhūṣitam saha tayā gaṇanātham
translated: With a body adorned with ornaments made of cow's milk, coral, gems, and gold.🔽The Lord of the Ganas, along with her, adorned with red fragrances, flowers, garments, and garlands,

original: puṣkareṇa kalaśaṃ ca dadhānaṃ sādhakopari kiradvasuvarṣam // //
analyzed: puṣkareṇa kalaśam ca dadhānam sādhaka upari kirat vasu varṣam
translated: Holding a lotus and a pot, showering a rain of wealth upon the practitioner.

analyzed: āmodaḥ utha pramodaḥ ca sumukhaḥ durmukhaḥ tathā
translated: Amoghasiddhi, Pramoda, Sumukha, Durmukha,

analyzed: vighnaḥ ca vighna kartā ca śaṅkha padma nidhī tatas
translated: Vighna, Vighnakartri, then the two treasures Shankha and Padma.

analyzed: śakra agni īśāna varuṇa rakṣaḥ vāyu aśra gāḥ tu ṣaṭ
translated: Shakra, Agni, Isha, Varuna, Rakshasa, Vayu, and Ashva are the six.

original: gaṇeśāḥ śaṅkhapadmākhyau nidhī yāmyottarasthitau // //🔽p / śvetau ca raktāvasitau ca vedyāvāmodapūrvāḥ kramaśastu vighnāḥ /🔽ṭaṅkākṣamālordhvakaradvayāḥ syurarvākkarābhyāṃ dhṛtadantabhakṣyāḥ // //
analyzed: gaṇeśāḥ śaṅkha padma ākhyau nidhī yāmya uttara sthitau  śvetau ca raktau asitau ca vedyau āmoda pūrvāḥ kramaśas tu vighnāḥ  ṭaṅka akṣamālā ūrdhva kara dvayāḥ syuḥ arvāk karābhyām dhṛta danta bhakṣyāḥ
translated: The Lords of the Ganas, Shankha and Padma, are located in the south and north.🔽The obstacles, starting with Amoghasiddhi, are white, red, black, and yellow in color.🔽They should have a small drum, rosary, and upper two hands, and lower two hands holding betel nut and food.

analyzed: śaṅkha abja saṃjñau sita rakta varṇau nidhī ca tad lakṣita hasta yugmau
translated: The two treasures named Shankha and Padma are white and red in color, and have two hands marked with them.

original: dhyeyau vamantau vipulaṃ dhanaughaṃ parasparaṃ saṃmukhayakṣaveṣau // //
analyzed: dhyeyau vamantau vipulam dhana ogham parasparam saṃmukha yakṣa veṣau
translated: They should be visualized facing each other, in the form of Yakshas, vomiting forth a great flood of wealth.

original: tīvrā ca jvālinī caiva mohinī sogadā tathā /
analyzed: tīvrā ca jvālinī ca eva mohinī sogadā tathā
translated: Tivra, Jvalini, Mohini, and Oghada,

analyzed: kāminī ca iti tejiṣṭhā ṣaṣ āmoda ādi śaktayaḥ
translated: The six powers beginning with Amoghā are the most radiant.

analyzed: aṅgaiḥ ca vighnaiḥ nidhi yugma yuktaiḥ lakṣya ādibhiḥ ca api atha mātṛbhiḥ ca
translated: With the limbs, obstacles, pairs of treasures, targets, and so on, and also with the mothers,

original: śakrādibhiścāvaraṇāni caivaṃ pañcaiva pūjyāni yathākrameṇa // //🔽padmāmbujākṣau puratastu bilve yāmyāṃ vaṭādho girijāvṛṣāṅkau /
analyzed: śakra ādibhiḥ ca āvaraṇāni ca evam pañca eva pūjyāni yathākrameṇa  padma ambuja akṣau puratas tu bilve yāmyām vaṭa adhas girijā vṛṣāṅkau
translated: The five protective circles should be worshipped in order, along with Indra and others.🔽In front, on the lotus and water lily, Bilva, in the south, under the banyan tree, Girija and the bull-marked one,

original: paścāt tu bodhau ratipuṣpabāṇau saumye priyaṅgau ca mahīvarāhau // //🔽padmadvayārisitaśaṅkhakarau puroktau pāśāṅkuśatriśikhaṭaṅkakarāvumeśau /
analyzed: paścāt tu bodhau ratipuṣpabāṇau saumye priyaṅgau ca mahīvarāhau  / padma dvaya ari sita śaṅkha karau purā uktau pāśa aṅkuśa triśikha ṭaṅka karau umā īśau
translated: In the west, on the bodhi tree, Rati, Pushpa, and Vana, in the north, Priyanga and the earth boar.

analyzed: yugma utpala smaradhanuḥ kusumeṣu hastau anyau ca śāli śukra cakra gadāḥ dadhānau  /
translated: The two mentioned earlier, holding a lotus, an arrow, a bow, and a flower, and the two others, holding a pair of lotuses, a flower, a bow, and arrows, and a rice grain, semen, a discus, and a mace.

original: dāmpatyaṃ te prārthayamānāścirasaukhyaṃ vighnādhīśaṃ sāñjalibandhāḥ prayajante /
analyzed: dāmpatyam te prārthayamānāḥ cira saukhyam vighna adhīśam sa añjalibandhāḥ prayajante
translated: They, desiring a long and happy married life, worship the lord of obstacles with folded hands.

original: bāhye caiṣāṃ sāyudhavāhā haridīśā dhyeyāḥ sarve divyavibhūṣāmbaragandhāḥ // //
analyzed: bāhye ca eṣām sa āyudha vāhāḥ dhyeyāḥ sarve divya vibhūṣā ambara gandhāḥ
translated: And outside them, all the Hari lords, with weapons and vehicles, should be meditated upon, adorned with divine ornaments, garments, and fragrances.

analyzed: ādhāra śakti ādi saroruha antam iṣṭvā purovat nija nāmadheyaiḥ
translated: Having worshipped from the foundation power up to the lotus, as before, with one's own names,

analyzed: devaḥ sa pañca āvaraṇaḥ yathāvat pūjya ūṅga mūlaiḥ prathama upacāraiḥ
translated: The god along with the five coverings should be worshipped properly with the limbs and root mantras, the first offerings.

original: bhittau paṭe vā kanakādibere samyak pratiṣṭhāpya mahāgaṇeśam /
analyzed: bhittau paṭe vā kanaka ādi bere samyak pratiṣṭhāpya mahāgaṇeśam
translated: Having properly installed the great Gaṇeśa on a wall or a golden image,

original: saṃpūjayet prāpya tu mantradīkṣāṃ prāgvābhiṣiktastu gaṇeśakumbhaiḥ // //
analyzed: saṃpūjayet prāpya tu mantra dīkṣām prāk vā abhiṣiktaḥ tu gaṇeśa kumbhaiḥ
translated: one should worship him after receiving the initiation of the mantra, or first being consecrated with the Gaṇeśa pitchers.

analyzed: japet catur lakṣam atha aṣṭa bhakṣyaiḥ hutvā daśa aṃśam tu athavā sva śaktyā
translated: And one should perform four lakh japa, and offer oblations with eight types of food, one-tenth of the japa, or according to one's ability.

original: smṛtvā gaṇeśaṃ manasāpi ceṣṭvā sidhyet tu mantro'sya samīhitaṃ ca // //🔽ākhurhaimaḥ parvatakūṭapratimaḥ prāgīśopānte kṣetrapatiḥ syād gaṇacaṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: smṛtvā gaṇeśam manasā api ca iṣṭvā sidhyet tu mantraḥ usya samīhitam ca  ākhuḥ haimaḥ parvata kūṭa pratimaḥ prāgīśa upānte kṣetrapatiḥ syāt gaṇacaṇḍaḥ
translated: Even by remembering Gaṇeśa in the mind and worshipping him, one's mantra will be accomplished and one's desires fulfilled.

analyzed: pūjyaḥ prāgvat bhakṣya huta ādyaiḥ sakala arthāḥ sidhyanti asya ācārya pada abja a hita bhakteḥ  /
translated: The rat made of gold, equal to the peak of a mountain, should be the lord of the field in the northeast. The fierce Gaṇa should be worshipped as before with food offerings, oblations, etc. All his desires are fulfilled by the devotion to the lotus feet of this teacher.

analyzed: nityam yathāśakti japet ca mantram santarpayet ca ambara candra toyaiḥ
translated: One should always perform the mantra japa according to one's ability and offer oblations with water from the moon-like sky.

original: bhakṣyādyabhīṣṭaṃ prathamāśramibhyo dadyād dvijebhyo'pi ca siddhikāmaḥ // //
analyzed: bhakṣya ādi abhīṣṭam prathama āśramibhyaḥ dadyāt ca siddhi kāmaḥ
translated: Desiring success, one should give the desired food offerings etc. to the ascetics and also to the twice-born.

original: caturdigdalāgre nyaseccāpi kumbhān pradhānaṃ ca kumbhaṃ sarojasya madhye /
analyzed: catur diś dala agre nyaset ca api kumbhān pradhānam ca kumbham sarojasya madhye
translated: In the four directions and at the tips of the petals, he should also place the pitchers, and the principal pitcher in the middle of the lotus.

analyzed: sa dugdhaiḥ ca vṛkṣaiḥ caturbhiḥ purā uktaiḥ tathā ca oṣadhībhiḥ lipet ambubhiḥ ca
translated: With the four trees mentioned before, full of milk, and with herbs, he should smear them with water.

original: p / saratnaiśca gandhaiḥ supuṣpaiśca hemnā supūrṇān ghaṭāṃstān savastrān purovat /
analyzed: sa ratnaiḥ ca gandhaiḥ su puṣpaiḥ ca hemnā su pūrṇān ghaṭān tān sa vastrān purovat
translated: The pitchers, filled with gold, gems, fragrances, and good flowers, along with clothes, as before,

original: niveśyātha devaṃ gaṇeśaṃ tu madhye tathaindrādikumbheṣu yugmāni ceṣṭvā // //
analyzed: niveśya atha devam gaṇeśam tu madhye tathā aindra ādi kumbheṣu yugmāni ca iṣṭvā
translated: Having installed Lord Ganesha in the middle, and having worshipped the pairs in the pitchers beginning with Indra,

original: vibhūṣyātha vastraiśca gandhaistatheṣṭvā samūlaistadaṅgaiḥ sajīvān vidadhyāt /🔽japitvā tu śaktyā ca hutvābhiṣiñcet prasidhyeddhi mantraḥ svabhīṣṭaṃ ca vindet // //
analyzed: vibhūṣya atha vastraiḥ ca gandhaiḥ tathā iṣṭvā sa mūlaiḥ tad aṅgaiḥ sa jīvān vidadhyāt  japitvā tu śaktyā ca hutvā abhiṣiñcet prasidhyet hi mantraḥ su abhīṣṭam ca vindet  /
translated: Having adorned them with clothes and fragrances, he should perform the rite of Jiva-samaya with their root and limbs.

original: annenānnasamṛddhaye tu madhunā svarṇāptaye gorasai🔽rgosiddhyai tilataṇḍulaistu juhuyālakṣmyai ghṛtenāpi vā /🔽dadhnā śarkarayā juhotu yaśase vāśvārikausumbhakai
analyzed: annena anna samṛddhaye tu madhunā svarṇa āptaye gorasaiḥ  rgo siddhyai tila taṇḍulaiḥ tu juhuyāt alakṣmyai ghṛtena api vā  dadhnā śarkarayā juhotu yaśase
translated: Having muttered the mantra to the best of his ability and having offered oblations, he should consecrate. The mantra will be accomplished and he will obtain his desired object.🔽For the abundance of food, one should offer oblations with food; for the attainment of gold, with honey; for the accomplishment of cows, with cow's milk;

original: rvastrārthaṃ kamalairnṛpaṃ tu kumudairdevīṃ ca tanmantriṇam // //
analyzed: r vastra artham kamalaiḥ nṛpam tu kumudaiḥ devīm ca tad mantriṇam
translated: for Lakshmi, with ghee; for fame, with curd and sugar; for the sake of clothes, with lotuses; for the king, with lilies; and for the queen and her ministers, with their respective mantras.

analyzed: āśvatthaiḥ vaṭa jaiḥ udumbara samidh plakṣaiḥ tu varṇān vaśe  kuryāt modaka piṣṭakaiḥ tu yuvatīḥ dravya aṣṭakaiḥ vāñchitam
translated: With ashvattha, banyan, udumbara twigs, and plaksha twigs, one should bring the colors under control.🔽With modaka and piṣṭaka, one should bring young women under control, with the eight substances, one should accomplish the desired.

analyzed: saṃsidhyet lavaṇaiḥ ca vetasa bhavaiḥ vṛṣṭiḥ bhavet tarpaṇā
translated: With vetasa-born salt, there will be rain by offering oblations.

original: nmantreṇātha caturguṇena sakalān kāmān japairvā hutaiḥ // //
analyzed: nmantreṇa atha caturguṇena sakalān kāmān japaiḥ vā hutaiḥ
translated: With the mantra repeated four times, all desires will be fulfilled by japa or oblations.

analyzed: icchet ced dvirada vane jala upakaṇṭhe kṛtvā ādau sama caturaśra homaśālām
translated: If one wishes, having made a square sacrificial chamber at the edge of water in an elephant forest,

original: tatreṣṭvā dviradamukhaṃ tu madhyavedyāmaiśānyāṃ diśi juhuyācchubhe'gnikuṇḍe // //
analyzed: tatra iṣṭvā dvirada mukham tu madhyavedyām aiśānyām diśi juhuyāt śubha ignikuṇḍe
translated: having worshipped the face of an elephant on the central altar, one should offer oblations in an auspicious fire pit in the northeast direction.

original: samṛddhimārgeṇa juhotu vahnau tasmin samāvāhya mahāgaṇeśam /
analyzed: samṛddhi mārgeṇa juhotu vahnau tasmin samāvāhya mahā gaṇeśam
translated: One should offer oblations in that fire by the Samṛddhi path, having invoked Mahāgaṇeśa.

original: tatastu bījairapi cāṅgamantrairhutvā purastādapi mūlato'tra // //🔽vargatrayeṇāpi vibhajya mantraṃ navaprakāraṃ tu ghṛtena hutvā /
analyzed: tatas tu bījaiḥ api ca aṅgamantraiḥ hutvā purastāt api  varga trayeṇa api vibhajya mantram nava prakāram tu ghṛtena hutvā
translated: Then, having offered oblations with the seed mantras and the limb mantras, and also with the root mantra in front,🔽having divided the mantra into three groups and nine types, and having offered oblations with ghee,

analyzed: samasta mantreṇa tad arṇa saṃkhyam hutvā aṣṭa bhakṣyaiḥ madhuratraya aktaiḥ
translated: having offered oblations with the complete mantra as many times as the number of syllables, with eight eatables anointed with the three sweet things,

analyzed: bhava udbhava abhāvana saṃkhyam etat śata aṃśataḥ brāhmaṇa bhojanam ca
translated: this is the number of offerings to Bhava, Udbhava, and Abhāva, and one hundred times the feeding of Brahmins.

analyzed: śaktyā atha tān vastra hiraṇya gobhiḥ iṣṭvā vaṭa antar dviradāḥ patanti
translated: Having worshipped them with wealth, gold, and cows, the elephants fall within the fig tree.

analyzed: tad labdha mātaṅga daśā aṃśataḥ asmai syāt dakṣiṇā mantri varāya deyā
translated: The fee should be given to the best minister, one-tenth of the obtained state of the elephant.

original: tataḥ sahāṅgaiḥ paricārakāṇāṃ baliṃ ca dattvā sahadevamagnim // //
analyzed: tatas saha aṅgaiḥ paricārakāṇām balim ca dattvā sahadevam agnim
translated: Then, having given the sacrificial fee to the attendants along with the limbs, to the fire god Sahadeva,

original: hṛdambuje sve gaganāmbuje vā niyojayecceti gajagrahaḥ syāt /
analyzed: hṛd ambuje sve gagana ambuje vā niyojayet ca iti gajagrahaḥ syāt
translated: One should engage in the lotus of one's own heart or in the lotus of the sky. Thus, it would be the elephant-graha.
The procedure of Mahāgaṇapati.

original: p / pañcāntakaṃ binduyutaṃ ca sākṣād bījaṃ gaṇeśasya vadantyathānye // //
analyzed: pañcāntakam bindu yutam ca sākṣāt bījam gaṇeśasya vadanti atha anye
translated: Some say that the seed of Gaṇeśa is Pañcāntaka (Na) combined with the point (M), while others say it is directly (Na).

analyzed: aukāra bindu antam udīrayanti tulyaḥ tayoḥ syāt vidhiḥ eṣaṇīyaḥ
translated: They utter the syllable Au with the point at the end. The procedure of these two should be considered the same.

original: gaṇarājāya ṭhaṭha / ekadaṃṣṭrāya huṃ phaṭ / acalakarṇine namo namaḥ / gajavaktrāya namo namaḥ / mahodarāya daṇḍahastāya huṃ phaṭ / vināyakāya vauṣaṭ /
analyzed: gaṇarājāya ṭha ṭha ekadaṃṣṭrāya hum phaṭ acalakarṇine namaḥ namaḥ gajavaktrāya namaḥ namaḥ mahodarāya daṇḍa hastāya hum phaṭ vināyakāya vauṣaṭ
translated: To Gaṇarāja, Thaṭha. To Ekadaṃṣṭra, Huṃ Phaṭ. To Acalakarṇin, salutations again and again. To Gajavaktra, salutations again and again. To Mahodara, to Daṇḍahasti, Huṃ Phaṭ. To Vināyaka, Vauṣaṭ.

analyzed: sva jāti bhāñji iti uditāni ṣaḍ yāni aṅgāni netra antam anukrameṇa
translated: The six limbs beginning with the eye, which are said to have the characteristics of one's own caste, are uttered in order.

original: gaṇeśvarāya ṭhaṭha / dhūmramukhāya ṭhaṭha / dhūrjaṭāya ṭhaṭha / vighnarūpāya ṭhaṭha / ityaṣṭadigbandhavidhiḥ pradiṣṭaḥ
analyzed: gaṇeśvarāya ṭha ṭha dhūmramukhāya ṭha ṭha dhūrjaṭāya ṭha ṭha vighnarūpāya ṭha ṭha iti aṣṭa digbandha vidhiḥ pradiṣṭaḥ
translated: To Ganesha, phat! To the smoke-faced one, phat! To the matted-haired one, phat! To the obstacle-formed one, phat! Thus is prescribed the method of binding the eight directions.

analyzed: vighnahantre ṭha ṭha lambodarāya ṭha ṭha
translated: To the remover of obstacles, phat! To the long-necked one, phat!

analyzed: sa ūrdhva adhara āśā kalanam vidadhyāt
translated: One should make the division of the upper and lower directions.

original: ṛṣistu nāmnā gaṇako virāṭ tacchandastu devo'sya vināyakākhyaḥ // //
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ tu nāmnā gaṇakaḥ virāj tad chandaḥ tu devaḥ sya vināyaka ākhyaḥ
translated: The sage is named Ganaka Vira, and the meter of this is called Vinayaka.

original: vratyāśano'muṃ japatu trilakṣaṃ puraskriyārthaṃ sa daśāṃśahomam /
analyzed: vratya aśanā umum japatu tri lakṣam puraskriyā artham sa daśa aṃśa homam
translated: One should recite this three hundred thousand times, subsisting on the vow diet, for the sake of preliminary worship, with a tenth part of oblations.

analyzed: catur bhujaḥ kharva tanuḥ gaja āsyaḥ lamba udaraḥ nāga kṛta upavītaḥ
translated: Four-armed, with an elephant head on a huge body, a long neck, and a sacred thread made of a serpent,

analyzed: dadhat sa pāśa aṅkuśa dantabhakṣyaiḥ pātrīm tad ālambita puṣkara agraḥ
translated: Holding a vessel with a noose, goad, tusk, and food, with the tip of a lotus resting on it,

analyzed: rakta ambara ālepana mālya ratnaiḥ vibhūṣitaḥ kuṅkuma piñjara ābhaḥ
translated: Adorned with red garments, ointments, garlands, jewels, and having a reddish-yellow color like saffron,

analyzed: dhyeyaḥ hi adhas kalpataroḥ phala arthaiḥ āpūryamāṇaḥ kanaka abja pīṭhe
translated: One should meditate on him, being filled with the fruits of the wish-fulfilling tree on a golden lotus seat.

original: aiśe guruṃ kṣetrapatiṃ ca pūrvamiṣṭvā tathādhāramayīṃ ca śaktim // //
analyzed: aiśe gurum kṣetrapatim ca pūrvam iṣṭvā tathā ādhāra mayīm ca śaktim
translated: Having worshipped the guru in the northeast, the lord of the field in the east, and the power made of the supporting element,

original: śeṣaṃ ca pṛthvīṃ tadanantapīṭhaṃ dharmādibhiḥ proktaguṇābjabimbaiḥ /
analyzed: śeṣam ca pṛthvīm tat ananta pīṭham dharma ādibhiḥ prokta guṇa abja bimbaiḥ
translated: And the remaining earth, that endless seat, with the lotus images of virtues beginning with Dharma,

analyzed: tad candra madhya sthita tāra madhye tu ānīya kha abja amṛta dhārayā indau
translated: And that moon in the middle of the stars, bringing the nectar of the lotus in the moon in the middle of the moon,

analyzed: vināyakam svaiḥ vṛtam aṅgamantraiḥ gajānanaiḥ diś dala gaiḥ hṛd ādyaiḥ
translated: Vinayaka, with his own limbs and mantras, with faces of elephants, with the directions and parts, with the heart and others,

original: koṇeṣu hetiṃ purato'sya netraṃ digbandhavighnāṃstu gaṇeśvarān ṣaṭ // //
analyzed: koṇeṣu hetim puratas sya netram digbandha vighnān tu gaṇeśvarān ṣaṭ
translated: In the corners, Heti, in front of him, Netra, and the six lords of the Gaṇas, the obstacles of the directions,

original: śaṅkhākhyapadmākhyanidhī ca diksthān koṇeṣu caivaṃ kramaśo'rcayīta /
analyzed: śaṅkha ākhya padma ākhya nidhī ca diś sthān koṇeṣu ca evam kramaśas urcayīta
translated: And the treasures named Śaṅkha and Padma, located in the directions, and in the corners in this order, one should worship,

analyzed: indra ādi loka adhipatīn sa vāhān iṣṭvā sva kāṣṭhāsu tad āyudhāni
translated: Having worshipped Indra and the lords of the worlds with their vehicles, one should worship their weapons in their respective directions,

original: yajeccaturthāvaraṇe tvathaiśe gurūnapi svān gaṇacaṇḍakaṃ ca /
analyzed: yajet caturtha āvaraṇe tu atha aiśe gurūn api svān gaṇa caṇḍakam ca
translated: And in the fourth enclosure, in the northeast, one should also worship one's own gurus and Gaṇeśa,

analyzed: āvāhana ādyaiḥ tu yathā upacāraiḥ iṣṭvā yathāśakti japet ca mantram
translated: And having worshipped with the rites of invocation and so on, as much as one can, one should recite the mantra,

original: p / bhakṣyādikaṃ ca prathamāśramibhyo dattvā yatheṣṭaṃ labhate'rthajātam /🔽rājānaṃ madhupiśitaistilairamātyān viprendrān sitakumumairviśo gulena /
analyzed: bhakṣya ādikam ca prathama āśramibhyaḥ dattvā yatheṣṭam labhate irtha jātam 🔽rājānam madhu piśitaiḥ tilaiḥ amātyān vipra indrān sita kumumaiḥ viśaḥ gulena
translated: And having given food etc. to those in the first stage of life, one obtains as one wishes the various objects.

original: śūdrādyān salavaṇataṇḍulaiśca hutvā kanyāṃ vā vaśayati mātuluṅgapuṣpaiḥ // //
analyzed: śūdra ādyān sa lavaṇa taṇḍulaiḥ ca hutvā kanyām vā vaśayati mātuluṅga puṣpaiḥ  /
translated: By offering oblations of rice mixed with salt to Shudras and others, one can bring a maiden under control with matulunga flowers.

original: aṣṭadravyairvā gulaśaktūnapi hutvā sarvāniṣṭānāśu labheran puruṣārthān /
analyzed: aṣṭa dravyaiḥ vā gula saktūn api hutvā sarvān iṣṭān āśu labheran puruṣa arthān
translated: Or by offering oblations of sugar cakes with the eight substances, one will quickly obtain all desired human goals.
